column4: Ubuntu installed properly, then it downloaded 200+ updates. After installing those updates and rebooting, it simply is not connecting to the internet anymore. It was connecting fine before the updates. What gives?
hows your wifi?
when you first install ubuntu, it acts different than it does when you reboot without the livecd (or livedvd).  So you may have been running the drivers without even knowing it.
system-->administration-->hardware drivers
i am there
It searched for drivers, and now a screen is up that states "No proprietary drivers are in use on this system."
find another way to the internet, like ethernet or a sprint or verizon wireless access card
ah, this sounds troublesome...
ive been thorugh the exact same thing...it sucks i bet u dont have a ethernet cable or a wireless access card.
when it happened i had to run to best buy and get an ethernet cable...
I do ;) will try your suggestion.
if you have anything already running ethernet, just use that cable temporarily so the situation doesnt get more complicated.
if not then u may have a bad etehrnet cable, or ethernet card, or wired switch may be malfunctioning
how to get updates?
gotta get my laundry, be back in like 5.  id like to help you, so please be patient. :-)
that's fine. Thank you. let me know when you return
you there?
yes
restart and try again
my wireless internet seems to be working now. What!
perfect im fixing to drive somewhere glad it worked though :-)
